org.threadly.util

Class Clock

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.util.Clock

  • public class Clock
extends java.lang.Object

    This is a utility class for low-resolution timing which avoids frequent System.currentTimeMillis() calls (which perform poorly because they require system calls).

    Each call to Clock.lastKnownTimeMillis() will return the value of System.currentTimeMillis() as of the last call to Clock.accurateTime(). This means lastKnownTimeMillis() will only be as accurate as the frequency with which accurateTime() is called.

    In order to ensure a minimum level of accuracy, by default a thread is started to call accurateTime() every 100 milliseconds. This can be disabled by calling stopClockUpdateThread().

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static long accurateTime()
      Updates the clock and returns the accurate time.
      static long lastKnownTimeMillis()
      Getter for the last known time in milliseconds.
      static void startClockUpdateThread()
      Starts a thread to regularly updated the clock automatically.
      static void stopClockUpdateThread()
      Stops the clock from updating automatically.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • startClockUpdateThread

        public static void startClockUpdateThread()
        Starts a thread to regularly updated the clock automatically.

      • stopClockUpdateThread

        public static void stopClockUpdateThread()
        Stops the clock from updating automatically. This call blocks until the automatic update thread stops, or until this thread is interrupted.

      • lastKnownTimeMillis

        public static long lastKnownTimeMillis()
        Getter for the last known time in milliseconds. This time is considered semi-accurate, based off the last time accurate time has been requested, or this class has automatically updated the time (unless requested to stop automatically updating).
        Returns:
        last known time in milliseconds

      • accurateTime

        public static long accurateTime()
        Updates the clock and returns the accurate time.
        Returns:
        accurate time in milliseconds
